page.title: 18TRAINING A SHEEPDOG
page.content: Training a sheepdog is easier with some dogs than others. First you get about 10 sheep and take the dog on a lead to the field. You get the sheep into the corner and you let the dog try and keep them there. A good dog should go very wide around them, but some dogs go very tight. Next you make him lie down, and you go between the dog and the sheep. You give him the command to go left, but he doesn't know it. If he goes to the right you stop him and make him go left. You do this several times until he learns how to do it. It is the same idea for going right. Now he must learn to lie down immediately he is told. With practice he will be ready for driving. The commands are "Come by" (left), "Way to me" (right), "Lay down" (sit), "Get up" (walk on), "That all do" (finish work). WRITTEN BY GRAHAM, 11.
